The patient presents with reduced visual acuity (6/12) and a Relative Afferent Pupillary Defect (RAPD) in the left eye. This combination of signs localises a lesion to the pre-chiasmal Left Optic Nerve. The isolated right lower limb hypotonia is noted but lacks associated weakness, reflex changes, or coordination deficits to allow for a definitive second anatomical localisation, though it may represent a subtle manifestation of dissemination in space within the central nervous system.
